1.content:
Surprise surprise. Area 51 isn't just some place that the Air Force has to test new aircraft, and there's some truth to the whole Alien stories, but not in the same way as the stories claim.

So, what character do you want to be?
1.title: Welcome to Area 51

11.content:
Well, we could start off with the Main Outsider human, Jeremiah Johnson, or come up with another.

Name: Jeremiah Johnson

Race: Human

Status: Outsider

Former Occupation: New York City Police Officer

Reason for being in the City: Took a wrong turn after leaving Las Vegas when he was on vacation and broke down outside of the base. Was going to be given a room in the barracks, where he was to stay at until the personnel fixed his vehicle. Problem was that he caught a mermaid skinny-dipping- and realized that she was part fish. Personnel were alerted and the commander gave him a choice- 20 years in prison for espionage or 5 years in the Service, as someone who helped the residents of the nearby city. He took the 5 years- as a military record sounded better to him than a criminal one. Given his previous job, and the fact that there was an opening on the force, he was made part of the MCPD.

Hair Color: Dirty Blond

Eye Color: Green

Rank: New Rookie

Personality: More than a little nervous about his new job, but tries to get along with the others.
11.title: Outsider Human

choices: A Cat Stuck in a Tree
111.content:
"Wake up, Jeremiah."

Jeremiah groaned as he heard the voice. "Five more minutes."

Suddenly, the covers were yanked off of the human.

"I said, wake up."

Jeremiah reluctantly opened his eyes, and looked at Frank Greyfur. The werewolf held onto the sheets.

"But, it's Sunday," said Jeremiah.

"So it is," said Frank. "But that just means extra pay, on top of what you already make."

"I thought that we'd get the day off," said Jeremiah, as he got out of bed, and pulled out his uniform.

"You don't get a day off for the first month, and I volunteered for it," said Frank. "Now, hurry up. Otherwise those kids of mine will eat everything, including the plates, again."

"Seriously?"

"Actually, that's only happened a couple of times, but it's still annoying having several miss-matched sets of silverware and plate and the like," said Frank. "Now, get ready."

"Alright," said Jeremiah. "I'll get ready."



Soon enough, they were in the car when a call came over the radio. It was.....
111.title: Jeremiah Johnson

choices: I'll be the one to rescue her.
You'll be the one to rescue her.
She'll just have to jump onto the roof of the car.
1111.content:
"Car 147. Car 147." The call came over the radio.

Frank picked up the microphone. "Dispatch. This is Car 147. Over."

"Cynthia Stripes is stuck in a tree on 6th and Main."

Frank groaned. "Isn't it the fire department's job to rescue cats stuck in trees?"

"You remember what happened last time," said Dispatch.

"I'll have you know I'm happily married, and I don't want to mess that up by having some alleged 'Damsel in Distress' deciding to 'reward me' by getting into my pants!" Frank exclaimed. "Can't someone else do it."

"You know, it's funny, but there seems to be a wave of small crimes occurring, from Jaywalking to King Konging, to Dragons Having Too Much Hot Sauce, and a bunch of other similar crimes that happened just as we called the other cars."

Frank rolled his eyes. "Can't blame any of them," he muttered.

"What was that?"

"We're on it!"

Frank hung up the microphone and started to head towards the address. "Seventh time this month she's done this."

"What?" Jeremiah asked.

"Cynthia is a neko, or a catgirl, who likes to climb up trees, only to kick the ladder and claim to be stuck, and needing to be rescued," said Frank. "It's just a ploy to jump on her rescuer and get into their pants."

"Can she get down on her own?" Jeremiah asked.

"She could, but she'd call and complain about us not doing our job," said Frank as he drove past a dragon officer, who was involved with a fight with another dragon.

"Say, shouldn't we help that officer?" Jeremiah asked.

"They're brothers, and are wrestling over who will sleep with the wife tonight," said Frank. "Female dragons like to sleep with winners, although given how their respective wins and losses are even, I suspect they make arrangements beforehand."

"How do you know this?" Jeremiah asked.

"Work with a guy for twenty years, you learn about these things," said Frank.



Soon enough, they arrived at the location, and saw the catgirl seemingly stuck up in a tree.

"Could one of you boys be a gentleman and rescue me?" she asked.

Frank rolled his eyes. "Sure thing."

"So, what do we do?" Jeremiah asked.

Frank chuckled. "It's simple really."
1111.title: A Cat Stuck in a Tree

choices: They get called out to a Domestic
11113.content:
"She'll just have to jump on the roof of the car," Frank said, as he pulled up under the tree. "You can jump down now, Cynthia. The roof should be able to hold you."

"But officers, I need help," the neko said.

"At a sanitarium," Frank muttered. He spoke up. "I'm sorry, but we aren't allowed to get out of our car in order to catch you. You can land on the roof however."

"Come on, please?" Cynthia called out.

"This is orders from the big boss," said Frank. "If you don't like it, tough."

"Oh, alright."

Soon enough, Jeremiah heard a thud coming from the roof. He then watched as the catwoman scrambled down off the car.

"You take care now." Frank then stepped on the gas, and got away from her. "Knowing her, she'd try to open the door to get to us."

"How bad would it have been?" Jeremiah asked.

"Not too bad, but one's first time shouldn't be in the front seat of a cop car," said Frank. "That, and the dashboard gets in the way."

"How do you know that?" Jeremiah asked.

"Previous experience," said Frank. "You need to be very flexible. A naga can do it for sure, and maybe a neko, but never do it while on duty."

"Previous experience there?" Jeremiah asked.

Frank chuckled nervously. "Luckily, not while trying to do it in the front seat. Now, the back seat, that's a different story - more room for one thing, but keep an eye on the doors."

"They don't open from the inside?"

"They do not."
11113.title: She'll just have to jump on top of the car

choices: The first customer of the evening comes in
There's a fire in the kitchen!
The health inspector shows up for a surprise inspection
112.content:
John Stein was one of the human residents of the city, and what's more, he was the owner and bartender of the city's local bar where the residents could socialize and have a good time. The staff of the bar included three kitsune sisters, who worked as waitresses, Jessy the Cthulhu who was the bar's DJ, and Bob the dragon who worked in the kitchen.

The bar was a fairly popular hang out for the city's residents, but there were some times when business was rather slow, like tonight. John is standing behind the bar, while the kitsune sisters are going around and polishing the tables. "Hey boss!" Jessy calls from her DJ table at the corner of the bar "How about some music to liven this place up? I'm bored out of my skull here!"

"You don't have a skull, Jessy. But go ahead, play something." John replied. Jessy put on an upbeat tune, and one of the kitsune sisters started doing a little dance while she worked. "Oh yeah, this is my jam!"

Just then...
112.title: Even Monsters Like A Drink Now and Then

choices: The Minotaur sits and stays quiet the rest of the night
He leaves and John calls his cop buddies
1121.content:
Just then, the first customer that the bar has had all night comes stumbling in through the front door. He is a large and very muscular Minotaur, who was obviously very intoxicated but trying to act like he wasn't. He sat on a stool in front of the bar and spoke, his breath reeking of alcohol.

"Bottle of Jack." He said, placing some money on the counter. John hesitated. There was no way he was going to serve the guy more liquor, when he clearly had already had more than enough to kill him if he had been human.

"I'm sorry, sir, but you are clearly intoxicated way past the limit already, and I can't in good conscience let you have anything more to drink."

"Come on, pal. I've had a very long day, and right now I just want to relax and sit back with some hooch and try to forget what happened today."

"I sympathize with you, really, I do. But drinking yourself into a stupor is no way to-"

Suddenly the Minotaur shot up from from his seat and grabbed John by the scruff of his shirt, lifting him off the ground. "Listen here, bub. I've had a very bad day at work, plus a nagging shrew of a wife at home who's probably just waiting to clock me with a rolling pin as soon as I open the door. If you really wanna show me some sympathy, the least you could do is give me something to dull the pain, hmmm?" The Minotaur growled.

The kitsune sisters came running up to the Minotaur, trying to to get him to drop John. Which he did, but not before shoving them hard into the opposite wall. As John got back on his feet, he grabbed the double barreled sawn off shotgun he kept stashed under the bar for emergencies, he cocked both barrels and aimed for the Minotaur, the sound drawing the bull man's attention to him once again.

"You've gone too far, mister. I really don't want to shoot you, but do anything like that to my employees again and I will. Now, you can either sit down and stay here quietly until you sober up, or leave. What's it gonna be?"
1121.title: The first customer of the evening comes in

choices: John leaves for his Main Job as a Police Officer
Bob has a case of the Flaming Hiccups
1122.content:
"Do you smell something?" one of the kitsunes asked. "I think something's burning."

John sniffed the air. "Oh no!"

At this, the five rushed into the kitchen, and saw Bob with the fire extinguisher, trying to put out some flames,

The dragon grinned nervously. "Do we have a fifty gallon drum of water available for personal use?"

"What happened?" John asked, as he looked at the now scorched wall.

"Carolina Reaper," said Bob.

John groaned. "Didn't that time with the Bhut Jolokia, a.k.a. Ghost Chile, teach you anything? Don't eat peppers that have a really high Scoville Scale while on the job!"

"There's still the Dragon's Breath and Pepper X I've yet to try," said Bob. "I've had all of the other cultivars, unless there's some new ones I've yet to try."

"Stick your head in the lake, and after you drown yourself, get back to work," said Bob.

Jessy chuckled. "Him and hot peppers. Can't stand anything hotter than a Habanero myself."

"At least none of us live with him," said one of the kitsunes. "I just hope the bathroom is up to snuff. I remember the last time - you could smell the stench in the place across the street."

"I don't understand why people eat the really hot ones," said John. "I don't mind a little bit of heat to kick things up a notch, but it isn't much fun when all you get is pain." He then looked at the clock.
1122.title: There's a fire in the kitchen!

choices: "I might overlook this, if you're willing too..."
"Get it taken care of in 48 hours, and I will call it a warning."
1123.content:
Just then, the the bell above the front door of the bar rings, and everyone turns to see a female werewolf dressed in a professional blouse and skirt, holding a clipboard. "Hang on a moment, ma'am." Said John as he was wiping down the bar "It's been a slow night, do it might be a few minutes before we can serve you. "

"I'm not here for a drink." Said the wolf woman as she showed John some ID that said "Janet Fenrir: Health Inspector" "What happened to Larry, the other inspector?" John asked, and Janet shrugged "They don't really tell me about my predecessors, say it's not my concern. Anyway, I'm here to inspect your establishment for any potential health code violations."

John rolled his eyes, he knew what she was here for when she showed him her ID. But he wasn't worried, he made sure the bar was always in top shape. He let Janet go about her business, and not five minutes into her inspection, she called him into the storage room, where to his surprise and horror, she had found the beginning signs of mold in the ceiling.

"You know I'm going to have to report this." She said, which deeply worried John. He worked two jobs, as the owner of the bar, and part time as a police officer for the city. He relied on both his sources of income to pay his bills, and if the bar was shut down, that was a good chunk of money he would loose. "Can't we come to some sort of arrangement?" He asked, to which Janet replied...
1123.title: Surprise Inspection

choices: Janet calls - It's the Good Stuff. John can grow it or get rid of it if he wants
Janet Calls - It's a Very Deadly Mold that had Also Escaped the lab!
John meets Janet for Coffee - the mold was nothing special
11232.content:
Janet whispered something into his ear.

John jerked his head back. "No offence, but that wasn't the kind of arrangement I was looking for! We'd both get into trouble for that!"

Janet chuckled. "Had to try. You'd be surprised at how often some people fall for something like that."

"Let me guess: Sting Question?" John asked. "I am a police officer, so I do know about that sort of stuff."

Janet grinned. "Yeah. Truth be told, I'm what you might call a Special Health Investigator. I've been investigating some of the other Inspectors, and seeing if they are honest, or if they take bribes, of one sort or another."

"Well, I know that Larry never made me that sort of suggestion," said John. "He'd tell me to get it cleaned up within 48 hours, and he'd overlook it. Then again, my staff are told to look for this sort of thing, so that we can get this sort of thing taken care of quickly. I know that wasn't here last night when I checked it."

"Well, there is something else I am looking for," said Janet as she got out a sample collection jar. "Seems a lab created a new mold, and some spores managed to escape some how."

"Dangerous?" John asked.

"Only if you are allergic to mushrooms," said Janet. "It's edible, and was created as a cheap way to grow food in areas that have a hard time growing most anything else. It grows reasonably quick, and, once it gets a certain size, quits spreading, until it gets damaged, or harvested, and then it regrows to heal the damage." She then removed some of the mold, and placed it in the jar.

"So, any real issues with it?" John asked.

"Depends on how you define an issue," said Janet. "If you want it, it will take up about ten square feet of space, at about an inch thick, at most, which is nice, as you can sort of frame it into a three foot by three foot square that's about two inches in depth. If you don't want it, it's awful hard to get rid of, like most other molds."

"So, if this is the stuff you're looking for, would there be any issues having it?" John asked.

"I'd have to check the sample, but if it is, there shouldn't be any health concerns," said Janet. "Might need a special growing permit to have it grow here, but since it would save the price you'd normally pay to get mushrooms, it shouldn't be that big of an issue."

"And if it's just the regular stuff?" John asked.

"Oh, the usual," said Janet. "Get rid of it within 48 hours. That being said, I'll take this to the lab, and call you within the hour."

"Um, thanks," said John.

"Of course, if you wish to talk to me later, I know of a nice place we could go to," Janet said, as she wrote something down on a sheet of paper and handed it to him.

John looked at her.

The werewolf grinned. "For coffee, nothing serious."

John chuckled nervously. "Right. Coffee. Not dinner."

"And certainly not for-" she whispered into his ear.

John chuckled once again. "Right, certainly not for that!"

"Right," said Janet. "Never on the first date, and certainly not over a cup of coffee. After five dates and ten cups of coffee, maybe." She looked up at the mold. "Well, let's see what else there is."



About ten minutes later, Janet left.

"Well, that was interesting," John said, as he watched her go. He then went into the storage room, and looked at the mold. "So, what to do with you?"
11232.title: Talking about Mold

choices: Another night at the Tipsy Vixen
Jerome and Marissa are on a date
113.content:
Jerome Johnson was a resident of a small city in Ohio that wasn't on any map. It was one of those crossroad towns with a population that was under a thousand. It had no schools, no library, and just one traffic light. Crime was pretty much nonexistent. The closest big city in any direction was Massillon.

It was a simple life. Then Jerome just so happened to win the lottery which earned him a small fortune. After winning the lottery Jerome decided to see all fifty states for some adventure. Eventually he made it to Las Vegas. There in Vegas he met a rather enchanting woman named Marissa. The two spent a week together seeing the sights and going to those big Las Vegas shows and, of course, gambling in the numerous casinos.

Then Marissa vanished suddenly and Jerome looked in vain for her until he spotted her in what looked like a government truck just by chance. Jerome followed the truck out of the city and all the way to Area 51. Jerome had somehow, despite all the super tight security, had entered Area 51....or, Monster City as it was called.

Jerome expected to see secret military craft rather then aliens because he had been a skeptic of UFO sightings and the like. He found Marissa of course and found that she wasn't a human at all but a kitsune with nine tails who had disguised herself as a human for some fun. Unfortunately it was illegal for a resident of Monster City to leave without permission, if they were a convicted criminal. Marissa had to pay a hefty fine, but avoided any other punishment because she was practically worshiped by the MCPD....or the majority of it at least.

As a kitsune with nine tails Marissa had powers that made her into a practical goddess; she's able to change her form, size, weight and everything else into whatever she wants. In her human disguise she's a gorgeous sight with long red hair (orange in Monster City) and is six feet tall while Jerome stands at 5'10".

Jerome chose to stay in Monster City rather then be charged with treason and has made friends of nearly all the residents of Monster City. Jerome has short dirty blond hair and has a job at Marissa's cafe called "The Tipsy Vixen" where he is a bartender.

Now, let the story begin!
113.title: Jerome Johnson

13.content:
Going to take some characters and move them here.

Name: Duskero Aranto

Race: Vampire Demi God (son of Hecate) hybrid (no I'm not looking to God mod.)

Status: Native

Reason for being in the city: Mainly to duck and cover. Far too many humans spreading out. Staying in his old home was risky. Especially with never being truly able to go outside without looking like a burglar. Using his lovely shadows he learned from his mother would've been far too risky. Luckily, the city welcomed him with open arms. On one condition. He joined MCPD as a medical official.

Hair color: Pitch black

Eye color: Dark purple

Skin tone: pale

Clothing: dark blue pants and a dark blue button up shirt. Black sunglasses.

Rank: M.E. (Medical Examiner)

Personality: A bit of a sweet heart. But don't give him the opportunity to be a sarcastic twerp. If the opening appears, he takes it. He loves screwing with his boss and coworkers. Though on more than one occasion it's almost cost him his job. He's not too fond of newcomers. But if he's gotta deal with them, he'll suck it up in hopes of at least getting on their good side. Though just like his great uncle, he can hold a grudge for a millennia.


Name: Tania Kernova

Race: Pijavica (Vampire)

Status: Immigrant from Eurasia.

Former Occupation: Homeless, Revolutionary, Soldier, Clerk and Guard (last two concurrently)

Reason for Being in the City: Rose from the grave of an impious sole in East Romania, 1890; lived a quiet life, sucking blood at night. Perpetually on the run, she worked herself away from Clergymen and ever deeper into Siberia, circumscribing a broad arc between the Black and Baltic Seas as the Russian Empire met its end.

When the second Revolution hit, she was quick to decide to tone down her mosquito-like ways and become a Bolshevik, fighting in the Civil War and earning some distinguishment offing foreign interventionists, as well as in the War with Poland, and subsequent Collectivization Crises. She managed to survive the Purges -more due to the fact that the people who would've Purged her mysteriously did not survive more than anything else- and served during the War with Japan and Great Patriotic War, surviving after considerably discomfiture and eventually finding peaceful employment as a camp-guard in Kolyma.

For almost sixty years, she fed considerably better working with the system than she ever had against it, but after Comrade Steel booted the pail, she quickly became a liability to the new, Thawing management. Her kind and activities were ordered dispensed with during a certain NKVD manager's day in the limelight, and Tania made a run for it.

Almost liquidated, she illegally immigrated to China, then North America, eventually ending up in the only safe place in the world left for her kind. Fully aware of that last caveat, she keeps tabs open on Somalia and North Korea, while scrupulously trying to keep on the law's good side. The thought of deportation makes her very worried. She is determined to never take a unconsenting person's blood again, and works as a barrista to buy the expensive substance needed in question. Well, that gig, and also working as an informer for police whenever she can find the time.

Hair Color: Raven black (Skin is marble white)

Eye Color: Blood Red (Solid)

Rank: Civilian

Personality: Misses Russia a bit, but fully naturalized and no-longer in love with Communism after getting staked in the shoulder during her sudden and unexpected emigration. Normally cheerful and friendly, if a bit sarcastic, especially around people who already know her; always up for a bit of slapstick. Has something of a phobia of hammers, though, ever since she was captured as a Partisan and the Waffen SS broke every bone in her body (Including the ones in her inner ear) with one.


"Anita" Of The Third Kingdom

Race: Mummy (Egyptian)

Status: Immigrant From Cairo,Egypt

Former Occupation: Magical Curator for a small Cairo store, was found out to be a mummy by some people. Fleeing from the mob, she arrived at Monster City to seek refuge. Taking a job as their Magical Curator, looking over any evidence for the police.

Hair Color: White Gauze

Eye Color: Blue Fire

Personality: Anita loves messing with people, she is probably one of the oldest beings in the city. And most of those monsters aren't willing to talk to another being. So Anita spends her days spinning tall tales when she isn't on the job. Telling unsuspecting listeners of her "great" deeds, which anybody with a bit of knowledge would know were fake. The only truths she says when she isn't on a job, is the fact she comes from the Third Kingdom time of Egypt.


Name:Cullen The Gillman

Race: Fishman (Subspecies: Gillman, only one he says)

Status: Native

Occupation: Nobody knows where Cullen came from, it just seems like he was always in the city. He just keeps mostly to himself, but isn't adverse to conversation.Cullen seems to talk about very trivial things, but not to hide anything in a facade of chatter, just to enjoy the thing in general. He also has a weird thing going for him;if he doesn't want to be seen, nobody can find him.

Hair Color: None, Orange Fin technically counts.

Eye color: Yellow

Rank: Civilian Insider

Personality: Chatty, but reserved, Cullen has two personalities traits that shouldn't work. He stays away from people, but when they come to him, he is all too willing to talk. He also acts as a consultant on shady deals, allowing the police to be tipped off.
13.title: Horror-Type Creature

14.content:
Name-Zyla The Harpy

Race: Grecian-Harpy

Status: Immigrant

Former Occupation: Zyla was an courier for her islands, bringing various heavy objects to and from different harpy kingdoms. Her parents wanted more for her and moved to Monster City for her to really show her prowess. She joined the police force soon afterwards.

Hair color: Reddish-brown feathers.

Eye color: Red

Rank:Rookie

Personality: A flighty girl, trying to be sophisticated. Do to her dealings with various harpies, Zyla knows how to deal with stressed out or plain insane people. But in her mind, police officers have to be these stern faced sentinels, causing her normal demeanor to try and play at that.

===


Name: Tobjorn The Troll

Race: Norwegian-American, Troll

Status:Immigrant

Former Occupation: Leg breaker for his older brother's mob, the local policing unit took it down. He was only twelve by that time, so he couldn't exactly be trialed. So, with nothing else to do, Tobjorn left his ancestral home and moved to Monster City.Applying for the police to redo past mistakes.

Hair Color: None technically, but trolls do have a bunch of rocks that could be called hair. In this case, Orange Topaz for Tobjorn.

Eye color: Same as the hair situation.Orange Topaz.

Rank:Captain

Personality: Torbjorn is a rock of a troll, no pun intended. Friendly, but not to the point of condescending, Tobjorn is well liked among the other police officers. Some day, he knows his secret will come out, and he hopes the good he did will outweigh the bad.

===


Name: Emily The Hidebehind

Race: American-Hidebehind

Status:Insider

Former Occupation: No one exactly knows, she is a Hidebehind. One of the few species of monster that even other monsters don't know much about. Only the chief could possibly know her origins.

Hair Color: Covered by trench coat.

Eye Color: Bright Yellow.

Rank: Rookie

Personality: Quiet, but civil. Besides that, who knows what else?

===


Name: Ivan The Vodaynoy

Race: Slavic- Cheyenne-Vodaynoy

Status:Immigrant

Former Occupation: Ivan dreamed of greener pastures in the world, which for his monster kind, was limited to a few places. Monster City was just the most tantalizing of them. Joining the police force, he was happy to focus his mind on newer things.

Hair: Seaweed green

Eye Color: Turquoise Blue.

Rank: Rookie

Personality: A happy, immigrant, Ivan is thankful for his time in the country. If he could serve it in anyway, he would do so in a heartbeat. He is still has some sadness however, being the only Cheyenne- type Vodaynoy in the city.
14.title: Fantasy Type Creature

choices: Richard and Zyla are assigned to patrol the park
Richard and Zyla assigned to patrol the docks
Richard and Zyla assigned to patrol the downtown district
141.content:
*RING RING*
"Oh, buzz off" Richard said, knocking the alarm off the table. He heard a crash, and steadied himself for the day to come. Richard moved himself onto the edge of the bed, with one grunt, he pushed himself up. Yawning, he made his way to the small bathroom, taking a look into the mirror.

"Yep, still the same face I had before. Wait, could I somehow become a monster here? Nope, bad thought Richard, just keep yourself sane. " Richard did a hygienic routine that was normal for him; unfortunately, he was doing it in a environment that wasn't. Finishing up, Richard went towards a closet and pulled out his new uniform. Going through the motions to put it on, with a sigh, Richard then went back inside the closet to pull out a duffel bag.

"Well, off onto my first day on the force." Richard said as happy as he could be. He opened the door, and walked down a flight of stairs. Which, also lead down to the Monster City Police Station.

====

Richard watched as beings from myth, legends, or things out-of-this-world, came together a collaborated. The architecture was built differently than a normal station, in fact, it could be called a stadium than a station. Beings flew, slithered past, strode, hopped, or any other forms of transportation than Richard could ever hope to conceive. It was disorienting to watch this cacophony of movement, thankfully, somebody came to his rescue before he hurt himself.

"Richard, over here." A voice deep enough to be heard over the squalor of monsters called towards him. Honing in on the voice, Richard saw the owner. It was Frank, who was currently in human shape, waving over to him. Richard smiled, and walked over to him.

"Frank, nice to see ya" Richard said.

"Same, how do you feel about the place so far?" Frank replied.

"Kinda scared man, I know I moved in here, but I just now realize how big this place is. How did they build it?"

"Well, when some of your citizens are 20ft and above, it makes most building easier to do." Frank laughed, then looked down at a sheet of paper. " Oh, Richard, I need to introduce to your partner. You're both rookies, so both of you can learn together."

"I'm not that doughy in experience, I've been with the LAPD for 4 months already." Richard shot back.

"Yeah, but you haven't been in the MCPD yet. Now come on, daylights wasting." Frank motioned Richard to get on his back, shifting into his werewolf form, which Richard replied with a look that said "Are you kidding me?" Frank rolled his eyes, and still motioned to his back. Richard then shrugged, what was the worst thing to happen to him? Walking over, Frank allowed a piggyback ride for Richard. With that settled, Frank bent his legs and jumped upwards, Richard's breath escaped his lungs.

Flying upward, Frank landed down, and jumped up again. Richard's eye wiggled in his head at the fact. Finally, the jumping ended and the duo appeared to be in a cafeteria, which housed a couple of large beings in it.

"Oh, that was fun, how are you doing Richard?" Frank questioned

"Gah" Was all he could reply.

"Good to note, now come on." Almost to make sure the ground was real, Richard quickly followed Frank.

===

"Hey, Zyla I got your partner here. Come meet the fellow." Frank called out. The duo were converging upon a small table, its occupant hidden by what appeared to be a over-sized newspaper, well, to Richard anyways. The faintest appearance of feathers could be seen on the reader's arms.

Richard looked as the occupant lowered the newspaper, revealing a stunning woman with striking, red eyes. Oh, and feathers located on her head were another feature. She looked inquisitively at Richard, but not in a disdainful way. No, more like she did that because that was what others did in a similar situation. Like a child copying the movements of a parent.

"This...is... him..right?" Zyla stated, saying the words as though they were alien. Which hopefully she would get that Richard was human, not alien. Richard could hear a light accent on her tongue. Sounding like it was she an Eastern European of some sort, maybe Greek?

"What did I just say? Come and give this man a handshake." Frank smiled, and patted Richard on the shoulder. Zyla shrugged, and got up from her seat. Richard then received a better view of the woman.

He already noted her face, so a better view of her body was appreciated. First thing he noted was that she was taller than him; wasn't saying much, seeing as he was 5'6 in height. But even he knew she towered over him, 6'4, 6'5? Second thing he noticed was the feathers located on her arm, which were like those of a human's limbs. The feathers on her arms matched the feathers on her head; red that was dark enough, that one could mistake it for brown. Her torso was athletic, with a fairly small bust. What really got Richard's attention was her lower body.

Her hips were the widest things he ever seen! They were lovely in their swinging motion, hell, almost hypnotic. They were definitely wider than even a normal woman's hips. If they were a inch or two wider, they would have been absurd. He couldn't wait to see the butt they were carrying. Then Richard noticed something else; looking down, he saw that her legs were that of a falcon sized up. They could easily disembowel him if she decided to even kick him. Richard's dirty thoughts left his mind like the devil was upon them.

Zyla held her hand open. "Zyla, please to meet you Richie."

"Richard, and likewise."

"Rich - hard." Zyla rolled his name in her mouth. "Noted."

"Alright, introductions are done, let me assign you your posts." Frank butted in, and gave the duo their first assignment.
141.title: Richard Meets His New Partner.

choices: Zyla and Richard sees something going on, they go in to investigate.
It was a completely peaceful day.
1411.content:
"Soooo, where do you guys keep the vehicles?" Richard proclaimed.

Frank looked at him funny, Richard took the glare with stride. It wasn't his fault that he wasn't well accommodated to his surroundings yet. Frank seemed to acknowledged that point and indicated where to go next. A little crevice was located past the shuffling forms of some monstrosities. Richard tipped a nonexistent hat at Frank and made off with Zyla.

He straddled down the stairwell, the looming shadow of his partner made Richard all too aware of the fact he was way out of depth. Finally he made his way to the garage, where currently twenty vehicles were parked around the area. Even then, he say that many of the missing spots would only add up to fifty vehicles in the station.

"Huh, thought there would be more cars here." Richard said, Zyla nodded and then bumped her hips against his arms as she moved forward. Richard blushed from the strange contact he made.

"There are many different types of being here, each with their own body-types and movement. It would be weird for all them to use humanoid vehicles." Zyla put in her own "two-cents." Richard shrugged at her suggestion and moved towards his vehicle. He opened the door and went insides, feeling the a familiar scene that he was well accustomed to. Except the part where his partner didn't get into the car.

"You getting in?"

Zyla looked at the vehicle like it was the devil and weakly replied. " No..no... I feel that my services would be better equipped while being outside."

Richard would've told her to get in, but he didn't know the process of this place yet. For all he knew, he could've just broken twenty rules in place. He waved her off and began to start the automobile. He backed out of his space and drove towards the exit of the garage.

"How are you going to follow me?" Richard looked back at the harpy.

Zyla wiggled her impressive hips and posed her arms in a "T-pose." With a quickness that Richard almost thought of as unreal, Zyla appeared to have grown wings, almost as massive as her. Open mouth at the sight, Richard was brought out of it by the ding of the opening garage doors. He steadied himself and drove towards his destination, his partner followed him out. Zyla braced herself and jumped upwards, like a bullet she shot into the sky. Richard lost his view of her, but she was no doubt following him.

"Life here is going to get interesting." He proclaimed to no one.
===


"Life here is going to get boring" Zyla said to herself.

She and her partner had arrived at the park not even thirty minutes ago and they had yet to acquire anything to do. Zyla was unaware of Richard enjoying the sights of the city. He gawked at everything like a three year-old. Zyla, who grew up in a monster world, saw this as another Tuesday.

"Don't think that Zyla, your parents gave you the opportunity to achieve a better future. Thoughts like that will bring you down." Zyla said , she didn't think those words, she liked to say them out loud. Zyla thought of where she was at now and found the shunted negative thoughts out of her mind.

This was a serious world, not like the carefree adventure lands she traveled with her family. Those days of delivering packages to the multitude of islands in the Mediterranean were over. Now Zyla had to sit down and show herself as the professional she was. And with that thought in mind, Zyla formulated her view on Richard.

"My partner seems to be a little more experienced than me, no doubt getting it from some other precinct he came from. Although, he did look at my hips, are they too small? Dammit, I knew I was slacking off in my mating appearance. Zyla, how are you going yo find a mate with hips these small?" Zyla admonished herself in shame. The harpy flew through the air, while her partner on the ground covered the area. All seemed good for today, though, maybe something would break the peace?
1411.title: Park Patrol

choices: They get a call from the station
14112.content:
"Well, nice day, so far," said Richard, as he and Zyla took their lunch break.

"A little boring," said Zyla.

"When I was part of the LAPD, I was informed by my partner that boring was good," said Richard. "After assisting in an investigation of an accident where a family of four was killed, I'm inclined to believe that to be the case."

"So, you've seen dead bodies?" Zyla asked.

"Mostly from vehicle accidents, fires, and natural causes," said Richard. "I guess I count myself lucky there. Last thing anyone wants, from what I'd been told, is to roll up on a murder scene, and see something out of a slasher film."

"Can't blame you there," said Zyla.
14112.title: It was a completely peaceful day, so far.

choices: Zyla watched as the man(?) walked into a building
A voice called them back to the station, unfortunately.
141123.content:
"You want a drink?" Richard said to Zyla as the duo made their way across the park. She peered down at him and Richard winced back a little. Both her height, and her mostly stoic personality, made a very intimidating figure. But it did raise the question: was she an outlier of her species or a normal member?

"Yes, please." She smiled at Richard's suggestion. The officer walked off, heading towards the lakeside. Various stalls sold there wares, though, this city was different. Things that Richard couldn't even describe were hocked and hollered to various passerby.

Richard stared as an octopus like fellow handed a strange piece of meat to a three eyed girl. He saw small pixies flutter through the air like darts, mingling with bigger, bird-like entities. He gawked as he saw what appeared to be mermaids beached themselves on the lakeside shore.

He must've been staring hard though, as he saw a couple of the citizens looking at him funnily. He averted his eyes, focusing back on the topic at hand. He searched for what he wanted.

"I wish there was a guide or something." Richard thought as he looked over the strange assortment of foods and drinks. Seeing wonders that he could've only dreamed of when he was back at LA.

"Scuse, officer." A voice called out, Richard turned his head as he saw a dwarfish beings move towards him. The dwarf thing held up two strange containers,in them were blue liquids; Richard raised an eye at that, whatever was in them resembled soap more than actual drinkable things.

"I'm local; Yuri is the name." He drawled when he spoke, an accent that Richard couldn't place burbled out from his throat.

"Don't worry, Its nothing wrong with it. I make good for protectors; call in to check," Yuri smiled as he handed the drinks over to Richard, the dwarfish thing waddled off, leaving Richard confused holding two drinks. He peered as the blue liquid bubbled in its container, he walked off back to Zyla.

The pear shaped Harpy stood where Richard last left her, though, she did seem to be focusing on something.

"Hey!" Richard called, Zyla gently looked back at him, staring as he brought his drinks over. Mumbling a "thanks", Zyla took the weird liquid. She drank with a stoic face, which Richard mentally noted look surreal.

"Not to sound too intrusive, but what were you looking at?" Richard asked as he open his container and peered inside it.

"Oh, some monster." Zyla replied back, nonchalantly.

"Really? Whats the reason you're staring at him then?"

"Because he just came out of his car and thought he was being sneaky. He just put in about ten pounds worth of cash into a briefcase." Zyla responded, Richard spat out whatever was in his throat.

"What!"

"I was watching if he did anything else." Zyla told him with the a voice that said "Yeah, nothing out of the ordinary."

"Are you still watching him?"

"Of course." Zyla spoke. "And he appears to be heading down the street at this moment."

Richard gawked as he tried to stare where Zyla was looking at, only to find his vision only seeing blobs and dots.

"Where did you learn to see like that?"

"Harpy genetics, ship watcher, and family genes" Zyla told him."Now quiet, I need to keep sight on him."
141123.title: They see something going on

choices: Something goes on in the building that involves the two.
The duo don't have to get involved.
Some kid comes up to them, asking for help.
There's a problem in the Park.
1411231.content:
"Alright," said Zyla. "They just went into an abandoned building a block west from here."

"So, what are we going to do?" Richard asked.

"The smart choice first." Zyla brought up her communicator. "Dispatch. Got Probable Cause on a suspect, seen stuffing money into a briefcase while in a park, and walking into an abandoned building a block west of my location. Please advise, over."

"We have eyes on the target already," Dispatch replied. "Remain on Standby in the park, unless told otherwise, or if the situation changes. Over."

"Useful to know," said Zyla. "Over."

"So, we're basically backup," said Richard. "I don't mind that."
1411231.title: Zyla watched as the man(?) walked into a building

choices: They wait for backup and take their thing into lockup
14112311.content:
"Are you still watching him?" Richard said, seeing Zyla still peer at the warehouse.

"Yes." Zyla said.

Tapping his foot, Richard stood silently with Zyla still watching. The wind in the background was whistling in the, monster-kids were yelling and screaming, and the sound of urban noise filled the air. But Richard still felt that it was too quiet between him and his partner. He opened his mouth to give break the ice.

"You must be very...uh... good with your eyes." Richard spoke, smiling a little to make himself seem friendly.

"That is what my mother said." Zyla bluntly stated.

Richard temple his fingers and continued. "Didn't you say you were a ship spotter? I didn't know that is still a thing, I thought GPS had replaced that."

"In the human side, yes." Zyla said. "But Harpies generally can't buy that for their ships, unless we work through a more humanoid monster or shapeshifter. My family had to make do with what they got."

"What do you have to look out for?"

"Pirates, Human ships, wreckage..." Zyla was interrupted by Richard.

"Pirates? I know Africa, and some parts of Asia, still has them, but in the Mediterranean?" Richard questioned.

"Yes, there are pirates. Its not like in the human world where everyone is near the same size, or has the bigger and better tech than the other. Our pirates have their own specialties that we have to plan for." Zyla answered.

"Such as...?"

"Such as some of them could be over 30 meters long and be intelligent enough to trap your ship, or make it seem that their ship is a human one, and should I continue?" Zyla looked at Richard who whistled a tune to take his mind off of what he just heard. Turning back up, Zyla's eyes grew wide and quickly grabbed a hold of Richard, who yelped in shock.

They flew so fast, that whatever complaint Richard was about to say was cut off as the two landed on the roof.

"What was that for?" Richard huffed out.

"I just saw a flash of a M.E.G, what model I don't know." Zyla bluntly stated as she used one of her talons to cut open the roof door. Richard pulled out his gun and softly spoke to dispatch of what was happening.

"What a M.E.G?" Richard said as he went down the stairwell, doing his best not to look to closely at Zyla's bum.

"A Monster. Ending. Gun. Made in a variety of models and with a hundred accessories. Us monsters have so many different strengths, its hard to keep track of our weakness. Why not make an all purpose line of weaponry that can suit whatever needs for whatever you fight? Plus, some of them use air to blast out their packages, making it damn near silent. That flash happened because its another accessory, off the top of my head, I can't remember which.. That mean that one of the things here was tougher than expected." Zyla quickly explained.

Finally making their way to the floor, the duo saw the blood seeping out of the figure. Going over, Zyla looked at the figure closely.

"Its the guy I was watching." Zyla said. Richard walked towards her, before he saw something on the ground. Not wanting to containment the scene, he crouched down, peering intently at a broken vial of...something.
14112311.title: Something goes on in the building that involves...

choices: The stench proves too much for Richard
The attacker is still in the building
141123111.content:
"Okay, I don't know all of what went on here, but I'm all for waiting for backup, and for someone more qualified than us to collect the evidence," said Richard.

"You're right on that one," said Zyla. "Something really bad must of happened here."

"I think that the dead guy is an obvious clue there," said Richard. "Now, it might be a good idea to get to someplace clear; my stomach doesn't like the smell of this place too much."

"I hope you're not going to vomit," said Zyla.

"Likewise," said Richard. "That's why I want to get to someplace more open, like the roof, so that I don't accidentally contaminate the scene if I stay here much longer."

"I see," said Zyla. "At least on the roof, we'd have a better view of the area too." She then called the scene in.
141123111.title: They wait for backup

choices: Logan Silvian - High elf/Drow elf mix
145.content:
Name: Robert Swiftfoot

Species: Centaur

Status: Native

Former Occupation: Newspaper deliverer

Hair: Pinto-style, with brown and white.

Eye Color: Brown

Rank: Corporal

Personality: Robert is known for being able to move quickly, be it to convey orders that aren't to be spoken over the radio in case the system has been tapped, to transport prisoners to lock-up, or to take those who have been injured to the nearest hospital. That being said, despite that fact that his uniform includes a saddle and reins for "suggested steering" are attached to parts of his uniform, and armor, at his torso, he normally doesn't allow people to ride him while on duty, although he does tolerate curious children. Off duty, that's a different story, especially if there's a lady doing the asking.

Samuel Stronghoof

Species: Minotaur

Status: Native

Former Occupation: Butcher at a slaughterhouse.

Hair: Dark Red and Black, With horns that are three feet across, from tip-to-tip.

Eye Color: Brown

Rank: Detective

Personality: Samuel is a quiet individual, having no issues at sneaking up on unsuspecting suspects, and is fairly strong. He like being a police officer, as it allows him to get out more.

Nick Jakoby

Species: Orc

Status: Native

Former Occupation: Orcish Love Song singer (sounds like Heavy Metal), and still is on special occasions

Hair: Bald, but has mainly bluish-pink skin.

Eye Color: Blue

Rank: Lieutenant

Personality: Very friendly and outgoing, Nick has a certain reputation in the Heavy Metal circle, where people wish that he was still touring. However, due to a certain incident involving a crazed fan, Nick stopped touring, not because his secret was blown, which it wasn't, but because he didn't want to get jumped in his dressing room again. He is also the namesake behind the character of the same name in the Netflix movie Bright, with Joel Edgerton borrowing some of his mannerisms for the movie, and even has the actor's autograph, and a picture of the two of them, with Joel in full makeup, as well as Will Smith's autograph, although Smith had previously worked with Area 51 during the filming of the Men in Black movies.

Logan Silvian

Species: High elf/Drow elf mix

Status: Native

Former Occupation: Bounty Hunter

Hair: Blond

Eyes: Red

Rank: Sargent

Personality: Initially seems to look at others with more than a bit of irritation, and malevolence, but that's mainly because he has the eyes of his father - who was a drow, and drow's eyes tend to hurt when forced to look at something in a brightly lit place. In a dimly lit, or dark, place however, and his eyes are more relaxed, and he's less irritated. Of course, since he has to work during the day at times, he tends to wear dark sunglasses and a wide-brim hat in order to protect his eyes. His skin is fair, like a High Elf, but those eyes tell people about his hidden duality - and that is the fact that Drow's tend to be rather cruel. Of course, while Logan himself isn't cruel, and his father wasn't, he does use this belief to his advantage when questioning suspects..
145.title: Other

choices: They notice something going on down the street
1453.content:
Nick was enjoying his fish burrito as his partner, Susan Raja, entered the car.

"Do you have to eat that thing in here?" she asked.

"It's not like a street vendor has a table," said Nick. "Besides, you have a beef one, and you know I don't like the smell of beef."

"I just don't like being associated with the smell of fish," said Susan. "My husband complains that it ruins things for him when I walk in smelling like something that swam."

"It's funny," said Nick. "A weretiger complaining about the scent of fish."

Susan rolled her eyes as she rolled down the window. "Hopefully the stink blows out."

"I agree," Nick said. "I shouldn't have to smell beef."

Susan glared at him. "I like beef."

Nick grinned. "I like fish."

"We're going to have to do a little bit of sparring one of these days," said Susan.

"Nice to know," said Nick. "I'll let the others know. I think I'm still ahead of you in our matches."

"Only by six," said Susan. "I've got twenty three wins."

Nick chuckled. "Six or a hundred - I'm still ahead of you."
1453.title: Nick Jakoby - Orc

choices: Joseph pulls out needles filled with venom
Lawrence jumps in, using his own werewolf abilities
1454.content:
It was a scene that could have been in an Old West story; group of guys sitting at a table at the bar, ostentatiously playing poker, but in truth, they were discussing business, the illegal kind. Sitting at the bar, two men had their hats on, slouched kind of low on their faces.

"Have you heard enough?" the one asked, quietly.

The other nodded. "Should be enough to put the locals away for a good while, while MC gets the main target."

The one grinned. "Let me know when I can transfer there. I'd like to be able to do certain things more openly."

"Given that you're a SWAT officer, Lawrence Grey, feel lucky that I picked you to work with me," said the other. "Nothing like having a werewolf to watch my back when I'm out of MC."

"It will be fun to see what elvish tricks you use, Logan Silvian," the disguised werewolf said. "Still, I guess Tampa's not too bad of a place, minus the drug and gun smugglers."

"Right," Logan said, as he got up. "Cover me, for now."

"Sure thing," said Lawrence.

Logan walked over to the table. "Joseph 'Snake' Dawson?"

A man wearing sunglasses looked up at him. "What do you want?"

"Las Vegas Police Department," Logan said, pulling out his badge. "You're under arrest for murder."

"You're a little out of your jurisdiction," said another. "This is Tampa."

Lawrence came over, with his own badge. "And I'm Tampa PD, and the rest of you are under arrest for drug and gun smuggling."

"Why should we even believe you?" yet another asked. "You could have gotten those badges off the internet."

Logan chuckled. He then pulled down his own sunglasses, revealing his eyes to be dark red.

The group, minus the one already wearing sunglasses, backed away.

"What the hell?" one asked. "Those are contacts, right?"

"Do you want to find out?" Logan asked. "Otherwise, just walk outside, so that the Tampa boys can take you in for questioning, and I guarantee that they'll do some drug tests if you tell them about my eyes, and I'd wager that one or two of you will fail them."

The others quickly left the room.

Logan looked at Joseph. "What about you?"

Joseph took off his own glasses, his eyes having a snake-like appearance. "A drow? Didn't expect one of your sort to work for the Monster City Police Department."

"Just half," said Logan. "The other half is High."

"You'd have to be some kind of high in order to come after me," said Joseph. "I'm sure they told you how I kill people."

Logan nodded. "Venomous fangs. You like to inject your venom into people, one way or another. Of course, since deaths from rattlesnake bites are usually rare, and most people tend to know when a rattler has indeed bitten them, five folks dead within a month does start to get a little high indeed, and of course, since we were able to figure out that the venom actually came from some sort of serpentfolk, it wasn't too difficult to figure out the what, or the who, once we knew what to look for."

"So, what are you going to do?" Joseph asked, with a grin, two of his teeth becoming fangs.

Logan punched him in the mouth, shattering his fangs. "Looks like you won't be able to bite anyone for a few days!"

Joseph gave a growling hiss.
1454.title: Logan Silvian - High elf/Drow elf mix

15.content:
Choice 1:

Name: Amnaill Rak

Race: Alien from Planet Onroria. The Onrorians are peaceful and beautiful and specialize in academics and the arts, much like Athens of ancient Greece but with a female-centered society as most Onrorians are female.

Status: Amnaill is an Outsider who was drafted by the Onrorian oligarchy to go to Earth to find human males to bring back to her home planet as the population suffers from the disadvantages of its highly uneven female-to-male ratio.

Former Occupation: On her home planet, Amnaill was a university student studying to become a journalist. She had a passion for writing and reporting ever since she was a little girl.

Reason for Being in the City: The Onrorian oligarchy assigned the City as Amnaill's area of deployment as the research they had gathered for the mission informed them that it was the best choice for her since the City would treat her well, despite her being a non-human.

Skin Color: Onrorians have blue skin like that of the Na'vi race from Avatar.

Hair Color: Amnaill has eggplant purple hair; this is her natural hair color, as Onrorian hair colors range from all colors excluding dark green, brown, and red.

Eye Color: Like all Onrorians, Amnaill has pitch black eyes.

Rank: Given her passion for and expertise in journalism, Amnaill received the position of Detective.

Personality: Amnaill doesn't appear to be as independent as she genuinely is since she doesn't talk a lot and prefers to be with other people. She is blissful and happy most of the time but is volatile when angered, often displaying acts of physical aggression.

Choice 2:

Name: Her name on her home planet of Felinea was Eve of the Hallow, but her assigned name in the City is Halloween. Having no memory of her past life on Felinea, she has grown accustomed to being called Halloween and prefers that people address her as such.

Race: Halloween is a native of the planet Felinea, whose people are anthropomorphic cats. The Felineans are a culturally rich race that utilizes a world system similar to the concept of tribes in Native American culture. Felineans structure these tribes around familial lineage. Halloween has no knowledge of to which of these tribes she belongs.

Status: Halloween was captured and brought into the custody of the City ever since she was a newborn to serve as the subject for research on feline behavior and anatomy. At this point in her life, she was an Outsider, but after having been in the City for such a long time into her adulthood, she has now achieved the status of Insider.

Former Occupation: While in the custody of the City researchers, Halloween was still a minor and never held a professional occupation. However, she was allowed to attend a private high school for monsters in the City as part of an experiment on how she would react to harassment from peers.

Reason for Being in the City: The City researchers abducted Halloween from her home planet when she was just an infant to use her as a subject for research on feline behavior and anatomy. She spent her entire life growing up in the City under the supervision and custody of the City research department. Due to having been raised there since infancy, Halloween believes that the City is her real home and has no knowledge of her Felinean heritage.

Hair Color: Halloween has black hair and fur with a small white patch on her chest.

Eye Color: Halloween has bright green cat eyes.

Rank: When the Monster Police Force was under development and looking for recruits, the City research department staff recommended Halloween as a Detective due to her high intelligence and ambition. Halloween served dutifully and put out outstanding work and thus is currently Chief Detective.

Personality: Halloween is naturally hard-working, independent, and ambitious. She strives to do the best she can at her job and is extremely passionate about her work. However, due to years of living in isolation at the research facility, Halloween works better on her own and struggles when working with others. While she has excellent leadership and communication skills, she fails to understand that the way others act does not always revolve around her. Halloween becomes easily frustrated when her expectations don't come true and has a reduced ability to monitor her emotions and how she expresses them outwardly. She is also somewhat reliant on praise to maintain her self-worth and will become jealous and competitive toward anyone who challenges her or appears as a match to her in receiving the approval she desires.

Choice 3:

Name: Hooh'Hawh Vrucrak

Race: Hooh'Hawh is an alien from the planet Tubekorosuth. Tubekorosuthans are large, ugly, hairy, lazy, and unfriendly creatures. Their society revolves around crude entertainment, primarily featuring smut and the objectification of women.

Status: Hooh'Hawh is an Insider born to Outsider immigrants who migrated to the City in hopes to make a living off their artisan sculptures of beautiful nude women.

Reason for Being in the City: The City is Hooh'Hawh's birthplace. His immigrant parent raised him in the City to become a sculptor like themselves.

Skin Color: Hooh'Hawh has green skin that is warty like a toad's and perpetually greasy.

Hair Color: Hooh'Hawh has coarse mouse brown hair covering not only his head but also his back, armpits, and knees.

Eye Color: Hooh'Hawh has beady, squinty red eyes.

Rank: Hooh'Hawh was randomly assigned the role of Detective.

Personality: Hooh'Hawh can be friendly, but he is very selective about to whom he wants to be kind. Precisely, he does not like ugly women or people who express disagreement toward him. He is lazy with his detective duties but engages delightedly in reading his graphic smut novels and making his smut sculptures. He does not care if anything he does rubs people the wrong way and will argue with anyone who points out unsavory actions or traits.

Choice 4:

Name: Phantom the Echidna

Race: Phantom is a Mobian from the Planet Mobius. Mobians are anthropomorphic animals and come in a variety of species. Phantom, as the name suggests, is an Echidna, more specifically from the Yugin-Dae clan, which is known for their metal bones that allow them to retract metal blades from their joints.

Status: Phantom is an Outsider who evacuated to the City after a monster terrorized Mobius by eating another Mobian and wearing his skin as a disguise to trick other Mobians into letting their guard down so it could eat them as well.

Former Occupation: On Mobius, Phantom was a monster hunter. He began hunting monsters at an early age as monster attacks were a significant problem on Mobius when he was growing up and he wanted to do something about it rather than hiding away being scared.

Reason for Being in the City: Phantom seeks refuge in the City as it keeps him and his clan members safe from the monster that is currently on the loose on Mobius.

Hair Color: Phantom has blue fur.

Eye Color: Phantom has blue eyes.

Rank: Phantom is new to the Force, so he is currently a Rookie stationed at the coastal beach area.

Personality: Phantom is very friendly and sociable, often seen chatting and joking around with other Force members. He's very kind-hearted and will provide support for anyone who needs it. While often hyper, he is nonetheless dedicated and hardworking.
15.title: Sci-Fi type Creature

info.brief_description: If you think you know Area 51, you know nothing. The Police make sure of that. 820+ Views
info.description:
When one hears about Area 51, they think about Top Secret military aircraft and weapons testing, or, if they believe in aliens, where certain experiments are being done with alien corpses, including genetic manipulation. Thing is, those don’t even scratch the surface about what really goes on.

If one were to manage to slip past the roving armed guards, they would find out that the area around the dried-up Groom Lake is actually a city- one home to over a hundred thousand inhabitants. Thing is, the majority of these people aren’t exactly humans, and most of them aren’t aliens. No, these people are what most would classify as Monsters. Werewolves, vampires, kitsunes, nagas, mermaids, dragons- if it isn’t human, and seems to belong in the realms of myth and legend, or horror or even Sci-Fi, odds are it’s there. The city is simple called Monster City by the residents, as it was more preferred to its true name of Dreamland. What’s more, if an Outsider is caught past the guards’ patrol area, they aren’t exactly allowed to leave the city.

The Origins of Monster City can be traced back to the Expansion of America. Monsters fleeing from Hunters came to the New World, and would settle in remote areas. As America expanded, monsters were forced to flee. Eventually, they settled roughly a hundred miles north of what would eventually be called Las Vegas. Since it was Federal Government land, and undesired by humans, no one came to bother them, and the people were free to start building a life.

Then World War Two came along, and the American Military decided that they needed a place far from prying eyes, especially those of the German and Japanese. To their surprise, the area that they wanted was already inhabited. Initially, the military wanted to go to war with the creatures, until a certain high ranking general saw them himself and realized that negotiating with the creatures would be far easier than being involved in a secret war in the middle of the country, especially after he saw how strong one of them was, when his jeep ended up in an accident, with him trapped under it- the five men with him couldn’t lift the vehicle up enough to free him, but one werewolf, who saw what had happened, was able to lift the jeep upright. This general had a talk with the President, and convinced him to have a talk with the creatures.

Of course, the monsters had known what was happening in the Outside world, as there were creatures coming from various parts of Europe and Asia, and they were bringing tales of what was happening- genocide against those of different religions, State-sponsored Secret Hunts, and more. When the creatures heard that the American President was going to come, the leader of the community, a European dragon, decided that he was going to meet this human leader, and prepared himself for battle, making sure that he had plenty of fire in him, and that his scales and everything were polished to a blinding shine, as he wasn’t just going to walk away from his home, like others had before him. Much to his surprise, the human he encountered was one who needed to use a chair with wheels to move around. For reasons known only to himself, the President got the dragon to talk with him in absolute privacy, though the locals, the military, and the Secret Service observed them from several hundred yards away. When the two leaders came back to the others, they agreed that another meeting would be needed to discuss the details of the treaty between their peoples. What is known about that particular conversation is this; in spite of their appearances and abilities, the monsters and other creatures were indeed American citizens, and therefore were guaranteed certain unalienable rights, including the right to happiness, justice, and freedom.

Soon after this, the military was given permission to build their base and testing facility, in exchange for making the 25 by 23 mile area nearby off-limits to Outsiders, unless the Outsider was authorized to be at the facility for any reason. However, if an Unauthorized Outsider found out about the locals, said outsider had two choices, Military Prison for a minimum of twenty years, or live in the City as a resident for at least five years without leaving- unless there was an emergency- in which case the person would be escorted. In either case, before the person was allowed to leave, they had to sign a Confidentiality Clause- under Penalty of being charged with Treason, they were forbidden to talk about what they’d seen, or heard, or did.

As for the stories about aliens, it seems that Earth is a midway point for travelers between Mars and Venus, especially those planning vacations that last several Earth Years – in that they’ll wait until the Earth is in a certain position before traveling to it, then wait a few months before traveling to the next planet. Area 51 is something of a Resort town for these people, where they can be themselves, without having to hide what they are. In exchange, the military is allowed to reverse-engineer certain aspects of Martian and Venetian technology, like fuel efficient engines, cloaking devices, and even wrist-like devices that allow the wearer to change their form into something else. Also, the aliens like to buy souvenirs of Earth origin, especially Sci-Fi films about “aliens” – seems they treat them like comedies, over how ridiculous the “aliens” are made and such.

As for the Plot behind this story, New York City Police Officer, Jeremiah Johnson, was returning from vacationing in Las Vegas when he took a wrong turn, due to a faulty GPS device, and his car broke down on a road patrolled by Area 51 Security Personnel. When the Security Patrol located him, they contacted Command, and a deal was made – Jeremiah could stay at the base while the mechanics fixed the car, providing that the officer stayed in certain areas, like his room, and was to be escorted at all times, due to “National Security Reasons”, of course. Problem was, a late night excursion to the bathroom caused him to get lost, and for him to catch a mermaid skinny-dipping, and for him to realize that she was part fish, and that it wasn’t a dream either, especially when the mermaid alerted the base to the apparent intruder.

Needless to say, Jeremiah Johnson was given a choice, 20 years in a Military Prison, under some charge of espionage, or 5 years serving at Area 51, and living in Monster City. Due to his then-current job of being a police officer, he’s given a job on the Police Force. Now he has to find his way around, learn how to fit in with the others on the police force, and how to work with his new partner, to say nothing about trying to keep the peace between the various factions within the city.

Of course, as with any city, there were those who cause trouble and special people are found to keep the peace. This is the story of these people, who spend every day making sure that the biggest top secret remains just that, Top Secret.

Rules

1. The laws of M.C. are basically the same as every other city- keeps Outsiders comfortable during their forced stay- plus it’s easier on the Area 51 military personnel, so that that they don’t have to do the job of protecting wayward humans.

2. Killing people just to eat them is classified as a capital offence- meaning that werewolves and dragons just can’t eat humans, not without paying the penalty- their life.

3. Spelling and Grammar are a must.

4. Story is to be in Third Person.

5. The creatures can come from all realms of Horror, Fantasy, Sci-Fi, Mythology, or your Own Imagination. Just create a Quick Bio of Sorts.

6. While in the City, the uniforms worn by the officers on duty look like typical police uniforms. However, when they investigate cases outside of the city, they look like something out of M.I.B - Black Suit, White Dress Shirt, Black Slacks, Dark Sunglasses (very important for non-human officers), and an expensive-looking watch that can actually cause the officer to change their species or increase their strength and speed, among other things, which is useful for hiding non-human officers and helping human officers in a fight where they are outnumbered.

See the following Campfires for the Inspiration for this - Truth be told, I had planned to make an interactive originally, but at 22 Interactives, and a then recent 10 interactive limit, I had hit the ceiling - so I'm recycling an interactive that went nowhere.

 Monster City Police Force  (18+)
If you think you know Area 51, you know nothing. And these officers make sure of that.

 Monster City Police Force Part 2  (18+)
Continuation of Monster City
#2065504 by BIG BAD WOLF Is Merry! (394)


Characters -

Name: Jeremiah Johnson

Race: Human

Status: Outsider

Former Occupation: New York City Police Officer

Reason for being in the City: Took a wrong turn after leaving Las Vegas when he was on vacation and broke down outside of the base. Was going to be given a room in the barracks, where he was to stay at until the personnel fixed his vehicle. Problem was that he caught a mermaid skinny-dipping- and realized that she was part fish. Personnel were alerted and the commander gave him a choice- 20 years in prison for espionage or 5 years in the Service, as someone who helped the residents of the nearby city. He took the 5 years- as a military record sounded better to him than a criminal one. Given his previous job, and the fact that there was an opening on the force, he was made part of the MCPD, and will be starting his first day.

Hair Color: Dirty Blond

Eye Color: Green

Rank: New Rookie

Personality: More than a little nervous about his new job, but tries to get along with the others.



Name: Frank Greyfur

Race: Of European Werewolf descent

Status: Native

Former Occupation: Served as part of the Special Special Forces during World War 2. Claims to have been “this close” (finger distance) to tearing out Hitler’s throat, if it weren’t for the fact that a fellow officer came under fire at the moment he was going to attack. Continued serving in the military, in one form or another, until a chance shot from an insurgent in Iraq destroyed his left kneecap. While given a replacement, he could not serve on the Front Lines any more.

Hair Color: Grey

Eye color: Yellow

Rank: Sergeant

Personality: Loyal to his friends, hostile to his enemies.

(Other characters can be found in the campfires)
